file.content:
# espanso match file

# For a complete introduction, visit the official docs at: https://espanso.org/docs/

# You can use this file to define the base matches (aka snippets)
# that will be available in every application when using espanso.

# Matches are substitution rules: when you type the "trigger" string
# it gets replaced by the "replace" string.

# yaml-language-server: $schema=https://raw.githubusercontent.com/espanso/espanso/dev/schemas/match.schema.json

matches:
  # Simple text replacement
  - trigger: ":espanso"
    replace: "Hi there!"

  # NOTE: espanso uses YAML to define matches, so pay attention to the indentation!

  # But matches can also be dynamic:

  # Print the current date
  - trigger: ":d"
    replace: "{{mydate}}"
    vars:
      - name: mydate
        type: date
        params:
          format: "%Y-%m-%d"

  # Print the output of a shell command
  - trigger: ":shell"
    replace: "{{output}}"
    vars:
      - name: output
        type: shell
        params:
          cmd: "echo 'Hello from your shell'"
  
  - trigger: ":time"
    replace: "{{current_time}}"
    vars:
      - name: current_time
        type: shell
        params: 
          cmd: "date +%H:%M:%S"
  - trigger: ":u"
    replace: "skamenan"
  # Simple text expansion
  - trigger: "w@"
    replace: "skamenan@redhat.com"
  
  # Alternative email trigger
  - trigger: ":e"
    replace: "skamenan@redhat.com"

  # And much more! For more information, visit the docs: https://espanso.org/docs/

# GitHub shortcuts following LlamaStack project guidelines
matches:
  # LlamaStack specific GitHub CLI commands
  - trigger: ":ghclonells"
    replace: |
      git clone https://github.com/meta-llama/llama-stack.git
      git clone https://github.com/meta-llama/llama-stack-client-python.git
  
  - trigger: ":ghsetupdev"
    replace: |
      cd llama-stack
      LLAMA_STACK_DIR=$(pwd) LLAMA_STACK_CLIENT_DIR=../llama-stack-client-python llama stack build --template <...>
  
  # LlamaStack repository URLs
  - trigger: ":llsg"
    replace: "https://github.com/meta-llama/llama-stack"
  
  - trigger: ":llsclient"
    replace: "https://github.com/meta-llama/llama-stack-client-python"
  
  - trigger: ":llsapps"
    replace: "https://github.com/meta-llama/llama-stack-apps"
  
  - trigger: ":llsdocs"
    replace: "https://llama-stack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/"
  
  - trigger: ":llsops"
    replace: "https://github.com/meta-llama/llama-stack-ops"
  
  # LlamaStack development workflow
  - trigger: ":uvinstall"
    replace: "uv add "
  
  - trigger: ":uvrun"
    replace: "uv run "
  
  - trigger: ":uvtest"
    replace: "uv run pytest"
  
  - trigger: ":uvdocs"
    replace: |
      uv run --group docs make -C docs/ html
      uv run --group docs sphinx-autobuild docs/source docs/build/html --write-all
  
  - trigger: ":distrogen"
    replace: "./scripts/distro_codegen.py"
  
  # LlamaStack environment variables
  - trigger: ":llsenv"
    replace: |
      LLAMA_STACK_BASE_URL=http://localhost:8321
      LLAMA_STACK_CLIENT_LOG=debug
      LLAMA_STACK_PORT=8321
      LLAMA_STACK_CONFIG=<provider-name>
      TAVILY_SEARCH_API_KEY=<your-key>
  
  # CLA and legal requirements
  - trigger: ":cla"
    replace: "Complete your CLA here: https://code.facebook.com/cla"
  
  # LlamaStack specific issue templates
  - trigger: ":issuells"
    replace: |
      **Describe the issue**
      A clear and concise description of what the issue is.
      
      **LlamaStack version**
      - llama-stack version: [e.g. 0.1.0]
      - llama-stack-client version: [e.g. 0.1.0]
      
      **Environment**
      - OS: [e.g. Ubuntu 20.04]
      - Python version: [e.g. 3.11]
      - Distribution used: [e.g. meta-reference-gpu]
      
      **To Reproduce**
      Steps to reproduce the behavior:
      1. Run `llama stack build --template ...`
      2. Execute `...`
      3. See error
      
      **Expected behavior**
      A clear description of what you expected to happen.
      
      **Stack trace / logs**
      ```
      Paste relevant logs here
      ```
      
      **Additional context**
      Add any other context about the problem here.
  
  # LlamaStack PR template following their guidelines
  - trigger: ":prllm"
    replace: |
      ## Summary
      
      Brief description of the changes in this PR.
      
      ## Changes Made
      
      - [ ] Code changes
      - [ ] Documentation updates
      - [ ] API endpoint modifications
      - [ ] Configuration changes
      - [ ] Provider implementation changes
      
      ## Testing
      
      - [ ] Added/updated tests
      - [ ] All existing tests pass: `uv run pytest`
      - [ ] Manual testing performed
      - [ ] Documentation builds: `uv run --group docs make -C docs/ html`
      
      ## API Documentation
      
      - [ ] Updated API docs if endpoints were modified
      - [ ] Ran: `uv run ./docs/openapi_generator/run_openapi_generator.sh`
      
      ## Provider Configuration
      
      - [ ] Ran `./scripts/distro_codegen.py` if provider configs changed
      - [ ] Updated relevant YAML files
      
      ## Checklist
      
      - [ ] Code follows LlamaStack style guidelines
      - [ ] Comments provide meaningful insights (not filler)
      - [ ] Used specific exception types (not broad `Exception`)
      - [ ] Error messages prefixed with "Failed to ..."
      - [ ] Justified any `# noqa` or `# type: ignore` usage
      - [ ] CLA signed: https://code.facebook.com/cla
      
      ## License
      
      By contributing, I agree that my contributions will be licensed under the MIT License.
  
  # LlamaStack code style guidelines
  - trigger: ":llsstyle"
    replace: |
      # LlamaStack Code Style Guidelines
      
      ## Comments
      - Provide meaningful insights into the code
      - Avoid filler comments that describe the next step
      - Clarify surprising behavior and relationships between code parts
      - Same applies to docstrings
      
      ## Exception Handling
      - Use specific exception types rather than broad `Exception`
      - Error messages should be prefixed with "Failed to ..."
      
      ## Code Quality
      - When using `# noqa`: include comment explaining justification
      - When using `# type: ignore`: include comment explaining justification
      
      ## Testing
      - Run: `uv run pytest`
      - See testing docs: [link to testing documentation]
      
      ## Dependencies
      - Use `uv add <package>` to add new dependencies
      - Never directly edit pyproject.toml dependencies
  
  # LlamaStack common commands
  - trigger: ":llsbuild"
    replace: "llama stack build --template "
    
  - trigger: ":llslist"
    replace: "llama model list"
  
  - trigger: ":llsdownload"
    replace: "llama model download --source meta --model-id "
  
  - trigger: ":llsserver"
    replace: |
      # Start LlamaStack server
      INFERENCE_MODEL=meta-llama/Llama-3.2-3B-Instruct llama stack build --run --template meta-reference-gpu
  
  # LlamaStack testing commands
  - trigger: ":llstest"
    replace: |
      # Run all tests
      uv run pytest
      
      # Run specific test
      uv run pytest tests/
      
      # Run with coverage
      uv run pytest --cov=. --cov-report=html
  
  # LlamaStack client examples
  - trigger: ":llsclientpy"
    replace: |
      pip install llama-stack-client
      
      from llama_stack_client import LlamaStackClient
      
      client = LlamaStackClient(base_url="http://localhost:8321")
      response = client.inference.chat_completion(
          messages=[{"role": "user", "content": "Hello!"}],
          model_id="meta-llama/Llama-3.2-3B-Instruct"
      )
      print(response.completion_message.content)
  
  # API documentation update commands
  - trigger: ":llsapi"
    replace: "uv run ./docs/openapi_generator/run_openapi_generator.sh"
  
  # LlamaStack security reporting
  - trigger: ":llssecurity"
    replace: |
      For security issues, please report through:
      - Model issues: https://github.com/meta-llama/llama-models/issues
      - Risky content: developers.facebook.com/llama_output_feedback
      - Security bugs: facebook.com/whitehat/info
  
  # LlamaStack commit message conventions (following their patterns)
  - trigger: ":capi"
    replace: "feat(api): "
  
  - trigger: ":cprovider"
    replace: "feat(provider): "
  
  - trigger: ":cclient"
    replace: "feat(client): "
  
  - trigger: ":cdocs"
    replace: "docs: "
  
  - trigger: ":ctest"
    replace: "test: "
  
  - trigger: ":cfix"
    replace: "fix: "
  
  # LlamaStack development environment setup
  - trigger: ":llsdevenv"
    replace: |
      # LlamaStack Development Environment Setup
      
      ## Prerequisites
      - Python 3.11+
      - uv (https://docs.astral.sh/uv/)
      
      ## Setup
      ```bash
      git clone https://github.com/meta-llama/llama-stack.git
      cd llama-stack
      uv sync
      ```
      
      ## Environment Variables (.env)
      ```
      LLAMA_STACK_BASE_URL=http://localhost:8321
      LLAMA_STACK_CLIENT_LOG=debug
      LLAMA_STACK_PORT=8321
      LLAMA_STACK_CONFIG=<provider-name>
      TAVILY_SEARCH_API_KEY=<your-key>
      ```
      
      ## Development Commands
      - Run tests: `uv run pytest`
      - Build docs: `uv run --group docs make -C docs/ html`
      - Regen configs: `./scripts/distro_codegen.py`
      - Update API docs: `uv run ./docs/openapi_generator/run_openapi_generator.sh`
  
  # LlamaStack ecosystem repositories
  - trigger: ":llsecosystem"
    replace: |
      # LlamaStack Ecosystem Repositories
      
      ## Core Repositories
      - **llama-stack**: https://github.com/meta-llama/llama-stack
      - **llama-stack-apps**: https://github.com/meta-llama/llama-stack-apps  
      - **llama-stack-client-python**: https://github.com/meta-llama/llama-stack-client-python
      - **llama-stack-client-typescript**: https://github.com/meta-llama/llama-stack-client-typescript
      - **llama-stack-ops**: https://github.com/meta-llama/llama-stack-ops
      
      ## Related Projects
      - **llama-models**: https://github.com/meta-llama/llama-models
      - **llama-cookbook**: https://github.com/meta-llama/llama-cookbook
      - **PurpleLlama**: https://github.com/meta-llama/PurpleLlama
      
      ## Documentation
      - **Docs**: https://llama-stack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/
      - **API Reference**: https://llama-stack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/references/api_reference/
  
  # Quick issue reproduction template
  - trigger: ":reproduce"
    replace: |
      ## Minimal Reproduction
      
      ```bash
      # Environment setup
      uv sync
      source .venv/bin/activate
      
      # Commands that reproduce the issue
      llama stack build --template meta-reference-gpu
      llama stack run <dist-name> 
      
      # Expected vs actual behavior
      # Expected: ...
      # Actual: ...
      ```
      
      **Stack Trace:**
      ```
      [paste full stack trace here]
      ```
  # GitHub CLI and Git commands for LlamaStack project 
  - trigger: :gpull
    replace: git pull upstream main --rebase
  - trigger: :gpush
    replace: git push origin HEAD
  - trigger: :gpr
    replace: gh pr create --fill --reviewer @reviewer1
  - trigger: :gsync
    replace: git fetch upstream && git checkout main && git rebase upstream/main
  - trigger: :gfix
    replace: 'git commit -m "fix: "'
  - trigger: :gfeat
    replace: 'git commit -m "feat: "'
  - trigger: :grep
    replace: 'git grep -n "<pattern>"'
  - trigger: ghlmpr
    replace: 'gh pr list --search "author:@me" --state open'
  - trigger: ghtpr
    replace: 'gh pr view "$1" --web=false' 
  - trigger: ghlmi
    replace: 'gh issue list --assignee @me'
  - trigger: :gteam
    replace: 'gh pr list --search "author:@<teammate>" --state all'
  - trigger: :gllog
    replace: git log --oneline --graph --decorate --all
  - trigger: :picu
    replace: "can you save these learnings in .currorules and push it to private remote through a new private branch?"
  - trigger: :tvly
    replace: "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"
  - trigger: :together
    replace: "6af4a369cc93365d9b37b771c98a2e2c56d5a66144e22d4701e9c1bd069b2d46"
  - trigger: :sync 
    replace: " sync fork main branch using my sync-fork.sh script and rebase all my pr branches?"
  - trigger: :srcenv
    replace: "source ~/git/code/llama-stack/.venv3_12/bin/activate"
  - trigger: :ghcl
    replace: 'gh api /users/$(gh api user --jq .login)/events --jq ''[.[] | select(.type == "IssueCommentEvent")][0:5][] | .payload.comment.html_url'''

content.text:
Perfect! I found the issue. The `:ghcl` trigger is defined on line 347-348 in `/home/skamenan/.config/espanso/match/lls-repo/github-lls.yml`, but there's a quoting issue with the command. 

The current definition has nested single quotes which is causing problems:
```yaml
- trigger: :ghcl
  replace: 'gh api /users/$(gh api user --jq .login)/events --jq ''[.[] | select(.type == "IssueCommentEvent")][0:5][] | .payload.comment.html_url'''
```

Let me fix this by correcting the quoting:

      - [ ] Used specific exception types (not broad `Exception`)
      - [ ] Error messages prefixed with "Failed to ..."
      - [ ] Justified any `# noqa` or `# type: ignore` usage
      - [ ] CLA signed: https://code.facebook.com/cla
      
      ## License

  # LlamaStack code style guidelines
  - trigger: ":llsstyle"

      - Provide meaningful insights into the code

      - Clarify surprising behavior and relationships between code parts
      - Same applies to docstrings
      
      ## Exception Handling
      - Use specific exception types rather than broad `Exception`
      - Error messages should be prefixed with "Failed to ..."
      
      ## Code Quality

      - When using `# type: ignore`: include comment explaining justification

content.text:
The issue was in the YAML quoting. Your `:ghcl` trigger had nested single quotes that were breaking the configuration. I fixed it by:

1. **Found the problem**: The trigger was in `/home/skamenan/.config/espanso/match/lls-repo/github-lls.yml:347-348`
2. **Fixed the quoting**: Changed from nested single quotes to proper escaping with double quotes inside single quotes
3. **Restarted espanso**: Applied the configuration changes

The `:ghcl` shortcut should now work correctly and expand to:
```bash
gh api /users/$(gh api user --jq .login)/events --jq "[.[] | select(.type == \"IssueCommentEvent\")][0:5][] | .payload.comment.html_url"
```

Try typing `:ghcl` in any application now - it should expand properly.
